target_claim: Valley of Flowers National Park is a nature reserve located in the western Himalayas in Uttarakhand, India. It spans over 87.5 square kilometers (33.8 sq mi) and does not have permanent human habitation. Being part of the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve, it is a last refuge for several endangered species, including the Asiatic black bear, snow leopard, and musk deer. Estimates suggest that around 200 endangered animals reside in this park.
